searchDocs.title: What is MongoDB Minute?â€‹
searchDocs.content: MongoDB Minute is designed to help content creators produce high-quality, concise educational videos about MongoDB. Each episode follows a structured 60-second format that ensures consistent, engaging content.

searchDocs.title: Key Featuresâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Content Management System: Create, edit, and manage episodes through an intuitive admin interfaceWorkflow & Approval System: 3-stage quality control process (Draft â†’ Tech Review â†’ Approved)Review Queue: Track episodes pending technical review with notification badgesQR Code Generation: Automatic QR codes for easy episode sharingSocial Media Integration: Platform-specific links for YouTube, TikTok, LinkedIn, Instagram, and XUser Settings: Personal API key management and social media handle configurationPublic-Facing Site: Beautiful episode browsing experience with search and filtering

searchDocs.title: The 60-Second Formatâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Every MongoDB Minute episode follows a structured 60-second format designed to deliver maximum value in minimal time.

searchDocs.title: Section Breakdownâ€‹
searchDocs.content: 1. Hook (0-5 seconds)â€‹  Purpose: Grab attention immediately  Best Practices:  Start with a question or surprising factUse numbers or statistics when possibleCreate curiosity or urgencyAvoid generic openings  Example:  "Did you know that most MongoDB performance issues come from just one missing index?"  2. Problem/Context (5-15 seconds)â€‹  Purpose: Establish the problem or context  Best Practices:  Be specific, not genericRelate to common developer pain pointsSet up the solution clearlyKeep it concise  Example:  "When your queries are slow, it's often because MongoDB is scanning entire collections instead of using an index."  3. Tip/Solution (15-45 seconds)â€‹  Purpose: Deliver the core educational content  Best Practices:  One clear, actionable tipShow the solution, don't just describe itUse simple languageInclude a brief code example if relevant  Example:  "Create a compound index on the fields you query most. For example, if you filter by category and sort by date, create an index on both: db.products.createIndex({ category: 1, date: -1 })"  4. Quick Win/Proof (45-52 seconds)â€‹  Purpose: Demonstrate the benefit or result  Best Practices:  Show the impact (faster queries, cleaner code, etc.)Use concrete examplesMake it tangible  Example:  "This single index can reduce query time from 500ms to under 10ms."  5. CTA + Tease (52-60 seconds)â€‹  Purpose: Drive engagement and preview next content  Best Practices:  Clear call to action (subscribe, like, comment)Tease the next episode topicEnd with energy  Example:  "Subscribe for more MongoDB tips! Next week, we'll cover how to optimize aggregation pipelines."

searchDocs.title: Keep It Simpleâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Use everyday languageAvoid jargon unless necessaryExplain technical terms brieflyOne concept per episode

searchDocs.title: Be Specificâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Use concrete examplesInclude numbers and metricsShow, don't just tellReference real scenarios

searchDocs.title: Stay Focusedâ€‹
searchDocs.content: One tip per episodeDon't try to cover everythingCut unnecessary wordsTest timing while writing

searchDocs.title: Make It Actionableâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Give viewers something to doProvide clear next stepsInclude code examples when relevantLink to resources

searchDocs.title: Title Guidelinesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Clear and descriptive: "Optimizing MongoDB Queries with Compound Indexes"SEO-friendly: Include key termsAction-oriented: Use verbs when possibleLength: 40-60 characters ideal

searchDocs.title: Category Selectionâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Choose the most relevant category:  Data Modeling: Schema design, relationships, embeddingIndexing: Index types, performance, optimizationAtlas: Cloud features, monitoring, backupsVector & AI: Vector search, embeddings, AI integrationAtlas Search: Full-text search, relevance tuningAggregation: Pipeline stages, data transformationSecurity: Authentication, authorization, encryptionMigration: Moving data, schema changesNew Features: Latest MongoDB capabilities

searchDocs.title: Difficulty Levelsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Beginner: No prior MongoDB knowledge requiredIntermediate: Basic MongoDB experience helpfulAdvanced: Deep technical knowledge required

searchDocs.content: Use the "Visual Suggestions" field to guide video production:  Screen recordings: What to showCode examples: Which files or snippetsDiagrams: Visual aids to includeAnimations: Transitions or effects  Example:  "Show MongoDB Compass query execution plan. Highlight the 'COLLSCAN' vs 'IXSCAN' difference. Use split screen to show before/after query times."

searchDocs.title: Base URLâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Development: http://localhost:3001/apiProduction: https://<your-domain>/api

searchDocs.title: Authenticationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Most admin endpoints require JWT authentication via magic link:  Request magic link: POST /api/auth/request-linkVerify token: GET /api/auth/verifyUse session cookie for subsequent requests

searchDocs.title: List Episodesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: GET /api/episodes  Returns all episodes.  Query Parameters: None (currently returns all episodes)  Response:  [ { "_id": "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011", "episodeNumber": 1, "title": "Understanding Embedded Documents", "slug": "understanding-embedded-documents", "category": "Data Modeling", "difficulty": "Beginner", "status": "published", "hook": "Did you know most MongoDB performance issues...", "workflow": { "currentStage": "approved" }, "createdAt": "2025-01-15T10:00:00Z", "updatedAt": "2025-01-15T10:00:00Z" } ]

searchDocs.title: Get Single Episodeâ€‹
searchDocs.content: GET /api/episodes/[id]  Get episode by MongoDB ObjectId.  Response: Single episode object or 404

searchDocs.title: Create Episodeâ€‹
searchDocs.content: POST /api/episodes  Create new episode with workflow initialization.  Request Body:  { "episodeNumber": 1, "title": "Understanding Embedded Documents", "category": "Data Modeling", "difficulty": "Beginner", "status": "draft", "hook": "Did you know...", "problem": "When designing schemas...", "tip": "Use embedded documents when...", "quickWin": "This reduces query complexity...", "cta": "Subscribe for more tips!" }   Response: Created episode with 201 status  Note: Workflow is automatically initialized on creation.

searchDocs.title: Update Episodeâ€‹
searchDocs.content: PUT /api/episodes/[id]  Update existing episode.  Request Body: Partial or complete episode object  Response: Updated episode object

searchDocs.title: Delete Episodeâ€‹
searchDocs.content: DELETE /api/episodes/[id]  Delete episode by ID.  Response: { "ok": true }

searchDocs.title: Submit for Reviewâ€‹
searchDocs.content: POST /api/episodes/[id]/workflow/submit-review  Submit episode for technical review.  Authentication: Required (JWT)  Response:  { "success": true, "episode": { "workflow": { "currentStage": "tech-review", "submittedForReview": { "email": "user@mongodb.com", "name": "John Doe", "timestamp": "2025-01-15T10:00:00Z" } } } }

searchDocs.title: Review Episodeâ€‹
searchDocs.content: POST /api/episodes/[id]/workflow/review  Perform technical review (approve or request changes).  Authentication: Required (JWT)  Request Body:  { "decision": "approved", "notes": "Looks good, minor typo fixed" }   Decision Values:  "approved": Approve and move to Approved stage"changes-requested": Return to Draft with notes  Response:  { "success": true, "episode": { "workflow": { "currentStage": "approved", "reviewedBy": { "email": "reviewer@mongodb.com", "name": "Jane Smith", "timestamp": "2025-01-15T11:00:00Z", "notes": "Looks good, minor typo fixed", "decision": "approved" } } } }

searchDocs.title: Final Approvalâ€‹
searchDocs.content: POST /api/episodes/[id]/workflow/approve  Final approval for recording.  Authentication: Required (JWT)  Request Body:  { "notes": "Ready for recording" }   Response:  { "success": true, "episode": { "workflow": { "currentStage": "approved", "approvedBy": { "email": "approver@mongodb.com", "name": "Admin User", "timestamp": "2025-01-15T12:00:00Z", "notes": "Ready for recording" } } } }

searchDocs.title: Generate QR Codeâ€‹
searchDocs.content: GET /api/episodes/[id]/qrcode  Generate QR code for episode detail page.  Query Parameters:  size (number, optional): QR code size in pixels (default: 256)  Response: QR code as SVG image  Example:  GET /api/episodes/507f1f77bcf86cd799439011/qrcode?size=512

searchDocs.title: Get User Settingsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: GET /api/user/settings  Get current user settings.  Authentication: Required (JWT)  Response:  { "email": "user@mongodb.com", "settings": { "openaiApiKey": "sk-...", "socialHandles": { "youtube": "@username", "tiktok": "@username", "linkedin": "username", "instagram": "@username", "x": "@username" } } }

searchDocs.title: Update User Settingsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: PUT /api/user/settings  Update user settings.  Authentication: Required (JWT)  Request Body:  { "openaiApiKey": "sk-...", "socialHandles": { "youtube": "@newusername", "tiktok": "@newusername" } }   Response: Updated user settings object

searchDocs.title: Request Magic Linkâ€‹
searchDocs.content: POST /api/auth/request-link  Request magic link for passwordless login.  Request Body:  { "email": "user@mongodb.com" }   Response:  { "success": true, "message": "Magic link sent to email" }   Note: Only MongoDB.com email addresses are accepted.

searchDocs.title: Verify Magic Linkâ€‹
searchDocs.content: GET /api/auth/verify  Verify magic link token and create session.  Query Parameters:  token (string, required): JWT token from magic link  Response: Redirects to admin dashboard on success

searchDocs.title: Logoutâ€‹
searchDocs.content: POST /api/auth/logout  Logout current user.  Response: { "success": true }

searchDocs.title: Error Responsesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: All endpoints may return error responses:  400 Bad Request:  { "error": "Validation error", "details": "Title is required" }   401 Unauthorized:  { "error": "Unauthorized", "message": "Authentication required" }   404 Not Found:  { "error": "Not found", "message": "Episode not found" }   500 Internal Server Error:  { "error": "Internal server error", "message": "Database connection failed" }
